p: As examples of the most common treatment options, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, both antimalarial agents with anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory activities, have shown inhibitory activity for SARS-CoV-2 similar to previous studies on SARS-CoV-1 and MERS-CoV ( Sanders et al., 2020). These two treatments are being investigated for use by patients with COVID-19 based on positive in vitro and limited clinical data. In addition, azithromycin, a macrolide antibiotic, was found to raise the efficacy of hydroxychloroquine as a complementary therapy ( Gautret et al., 2020).
